g.text: to temperature, bromide availability may also control the reaction kinetics for the formation of brominated THM
As expected, a lower content of the THM precursor organic carbon in water led to less THM formation during
). For 5 mg/L instead of 1 mg/L raw water DOC, THM formation at
a fixed temperature of 15 °C was significantly higher by an average 315
formation was less than the 500% increase in DOC concentration, which may be due to other limiting factors
involved in the complex THM formation reaction kinetics
, such as bromide. Indeed, the measured increase in
) the average potable water quality, and (
(DOC) composition, expressed as % hydrophobic organic fraction (HPO), transphilic organic fraction (TPI)

5) for the monthly average, relative to the annual average, calculated for the
case study sites. Annual average values were 9.66 °C for temperature, 1.08 mg/L for TOC, 43.93 mg/L for THMs,
40.1% for HPI, 18.6% for TPI and 41.3% for HPO.
Statistically significant linear Pearson correlations between monthly averages of the total or
individual THMs and other water quality parameters in potable water from five Scottish water treatment plants
